chunks.content: The #1 mistake people make in trying to get interviews? Sharing a generic resume or customizing poorly. There are 6 key principles of customization:
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
chunks.section: # How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews

chunks.content: Ask "What archetypes of person would the hiring manager be ecstatic to hire?" Then re-cast as many details as possible to become that person.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
chunks.section: 1. Recast Your Experience to Become Ideal

chunks.content: Make your winding path seem like a straight line to the job. Remove or minimize jobs that don't fit the archetype.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
chunks.section: 2. Re-tell Your Story to Be a Straight Line

chunks.content: If bullet points aren't positioning you for the job, the space can be better used. Developer experience might be more exciting than activation lift for internal tools roles.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
chunks.section: 3. Customize Every Bullet for the Job

chunks.content: AI Resume Screening systems look for keyword existence, not meaning. Cover all the bases the job description mentions.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
chunks.section: 4. Use the Keywords the ATS Seeks

chunks.content: Create a compelling reason to interview you. Drop enough storytelling so they want to follow-up.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews

chunks.content: Identify common reasons you might get disqualified and flip them into strengths through narrative and bullet points.
chunks.article_name: How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews
How to Customize Your Resume to Actually Get Interviews

chunks.content:
- Keep it concise but impactful
- Use quantifiable achievements
- Lead with action verbs
- Maintain consistent formatting

chunks.content:
- Research the company culture
- Match their language and tone
- Highlight relevant experience
- Show progression and growth
